Activity: Wake up, review financial news and potential impacts on statistical arbitrage opportunities.
Check emails, respond to any urgent requests. Review the previous day's work and plan for the day.
Refine the data ingestion layer architecture based on the feedback from @sdev-1 and @sdev-2. Focus on fault tolerance, data consistency, and monitoring.
Document the API specifications for accessing market data from the database. Define the endpoints, request parameters, and response formats. Include examples and usage guidelines.
Lunch. Discuss the project progress with @PM-1.

Work on defining the specifications for the trade execution component. Define the message format for submitting orders, the API endpoints for interacting with brokers, and the error handling mechanisms.

Email @qres-2 and @qres-3 to review the trade execution specifications. Request feedback on the required order types, routing logic, and risk management constraints. @qres-2 @qres-3 Topic: Trade Execution Specifications Review
Research and evaluate different order routing strategies and smart order routing (SOR) algorithms. Consider latency, cost, and execution quality.
End of workday. Contemplate the complexities of high-speed trading.
